page.title: 08HOME FARM.
page.content: {"HOME FARM"}is part of the Youngsbury estate. It extends for over 300 acres of cultivated land and 100 acres of rough grazing. The farm has a flock of 200 ewes,kept mainly for meat. They also keep some poultry. The main crops grown are wheat,barley and oil-seed rape. A lot of machinery is used. This includes,a seed drill,harrows,a crop sprayer,4 tractors,a combine harvester fertilizer distributors,a plough,etc. Because so much machinery is used,few workers are employed. The farm can be worked by the owner and his son,with additional help from casual workers at harvest time. The land on the farm gently slopes down to the River Rib and the soil is a mixture of clays and gravels. The sheep are grazed on the land in front of Youngsbury house. A threat to the landscape here,is the proposed A.10 by-pass of High Cross.
